originalTitle: Drones hammer Sudan's gold and oil zone - the pivotal new front line
title: A Friendly Chat About What's Happening in Sudan
content:
Hello, my wonderful little friends! It's your friendly news reporter from our amazing continent, Africa, here to share something important with you. Today, we're going to talk about a beautiful country called Sudan. Sudan is in Africa, just like many of our homes! It's a place with kind people, sunny skies, and big rivers.

What is Happening in Sudan?

Sometimes, in Sudan, people are not getting along very well. It's like when friends have a big disagreement, but much, much bigger. This means there has been some fighting, and it makes many people feel sad and scared. Lately, this fighting has been happening more often. It's like a loud noise that doesn't stop, and it makes it hard for people to live peacefully. We all hope for quiet and happiness for everyone. Did you know? Sudan is the third-largest country in Africa! It has a very long history and many different cultures.

A Special Place Called Kordofan

Now, let's talk about a special part of Sudan called the Kordofan region. Imagine your own town or village, but maybe a bit bigger. Kordofan is a region where many brave families live. Sadly, the fighting has been happening a lot in Kordofan. When there is fighting, people can get hurt. It makes us very sad to hear that many people have been hurt or are not safe there. Everyone wants to feel safe in their homes, right? Just like you want to feel safe when you play and sleep. The children and families in Kordofan want to feel safe too.

What are Drones?

Have you ever seen a toy plane that can fly without someone sitting inside it? Well, there are bigger versions of these flying machines called 'drones'. They are like robots that fly high in the sky. Drones can be used for many good things, like taking pictures from above or delivering small packages. But sometimes, people use them for fighting, which is not good at all. These flying drones have been used in the Kordofan region. They make loud noises and can cause problems from the sky. This is part of the reason why things are so difficult there now. Did you know? Some drones are so small they can fit in your hand, while others are as big as a small car! But the ones used for fighting are usually bigger and faster.

Why are Gold and Oil Important?

Sudan is a country that has some very special things hidden under its ground. Two of these important things are 'gold' and 'oil'. Gold is that beautiful, shiny, yellow metal that you sometimes see in jewelry, like rings or necklaces. It's very precious and special. Oil is a thick, black liquid. It might look a bit yucky, but it's super important! We use oil to make the fuel for cars, buses, and even airplanes. It also helps make plastics and other things we use every day. Did you know? Oil is sometimes called 'black gold' because it is so valuable and important for countries! These places where gold and oil are found are very important for Sudan. When a country sells gold and oil, it earns money. This money can be used to build new schools, hospitals, and roads, and help everyone in the country. Sadly, the fighting is now happening in these important 'gold and oil zones' in Kordofan. This makes the fighting even more serious, because these places are so valuable for Sudan's future.

How Does This Make People Feel?

When there is fighting, it makes people feel very, very sad. Children can't always go to school, and families might have to leave their homes to find a safer place. It makes mothers and fathers worry about their children. It makes children miss their friends, their toys, and the games they used to play in peace. Everyone in Sudan, and all of us watching from Africa and around the world, want the people in Kordofan to be safe. We want them to feel happy and secure again. Did you know? Many people around the world are thinking about the children and families in Sudan and hoping for peace.

We Hope for Peace

Peace means everyone can be friends and live without fighting. It means children can play, learn, and grow up happily. Right now, finding peace in Sudan is hard, like trying to catch a butterfly that keeps flying away. But people are trying very hard to bring peace back. Your friendly reporter wants to remind you that even though there's sad news, we always have hope. Hope is a strong feeling that things will get better. We hope that the people in Sudan, especially in Kordofan, will soon find peace. We wish for quiet days, safe homes, and happy smiles for all the children and families. Let's all send our kindest thoughts to Sudan and hope for a bright, peaceful future for our friends there. Thank you for listening, my little news friends!
summary: Fighting in a part of Sudan called Kordofan is hurting many people and happening in important places where gold and oil are found, making everyone sad, and we hope for peace to return soon.
whyMatters: This is important because when people fight, many innocent children and families get hurt and cannot live safely, especially when the fighting is in places that help the whole country get money for good things like schools.

originalTitle: Ex-Nigerian minister confronted tycoons who bribed her, court told
title: A Story About Rules and Being Fair in Nigeria!
content:
Hello, Super Friends!

Hello, super friends! Welcome to your special news from Africa! Today, we have a very important story from a big country called Nigeria. It's all about rules and being fair. Imagine you are playing a game with your friends. What happens if someone doesn't follow the rules? It can feel a little bit unfair, right? Well, in big grown-up life, we also have rules to make sure everyone is treated fairly and honestly. Our story today is about a lady who used to have a very important job in Nigeria. Her name is Mrs. Diezani. People are talking about whether she always followed all the important rules while she had her big job.

What Are Rules Anyway?

Do you know why we have rules? Rules are like special instructions that help us all live together happily. They tell us what is good to do and what is not good to do. For example, at school, you have rules like 'share your toys' or 'listen to your teacher.' These rules help everyone have a good time and learn. In our big cities and countries, there are even more rules. These rules help everyone, from the littlest child to the oldest grown-up, stay safe and be treated with kindness and fairness. Our story from Nigeria today is about grown-up rules and how we make sure everyone plays fair.

Did you know? Nigeria is a very big country in Africa! It has lots of different people, beautiful languages, and amazing places to explore!

What Happened with Mrs. Diezani?

Okay, so there's a lady named Mrs. Diezani. She used to have a very important job helping to look after things in Nigeria. She was like a very important helper for the whole country. Now, some people are saying that when she had this big job, she was given some special presents by some very rich people. These weren't just 'happy birthday' presents. These were presents that maybe, just maybe, were given to make her do special favours that weren't fair to everyone else. It's like if someone gives you extra sweets so you let them jump to the front of the line. That wouldn't be fair, would it? These special, unfair presents are sometimes called 'bribes.'

Did you know? Grown-ups have special rules called 'laws' to make sure everyone is honest when they have important jobs in the government!

What are 'Bad Presents'?

Imagine you are sharing snacks with your friends. If someone offers you their whole packet of biscuits just so you let them be first in every game, even when it's not their turn, that wouldn't be very fair to the other children, would it? That's kind of what a 'bad present' or a 'bribe' is. It's when someone gives something special – like money or a fancy toy – to a person with an important job. They give it hoping that the person will then do something special for them that isn't fair to everyone else. It makes the rules unfair for others. Important helpers for the country must always be fair to everyone, not just to people who give them special things.

Did you know? Being honest means always telling the truth and doing the right thing, even when no one is watching! It makes people trust you!

Going to a Special Room: The Court

When someone says that a grown-up might not have followed the rules, especially very important rules like those about fairness and 'bad presents,' they go to a special place. This place is called a 'court.' A court is like a big, quiet room where a special grown-up called a 'judge' listens very carefully. The judge is like a super-listener who helps everyone figure out the truth. In the court, different people tell their side of the story. It's a bit like when you and your friend have a disagreement, and a teacher helps you both talk about it to find out what really happened.

Did you know? In a court, everyone gets a chance to tell their side of the story! It's very important to listen to everyone so we can find the truth!

What Mrs. Diezani Says

So, in this special court, people are talking about Mrs. Diezani. They are saying she took five of these 'bad presents.' They also say she might have planned with other people to take these 'bad presents.' But Mrs. Diezani herself says, 'No, that's not true! I did not take those bad presents, and I did not plan to do anything unfair.' She says she followed all the rules. It's like if someone says you took their crayon, but you say, 'No, I didn't! It wasn't me!' Everyone in the court listens carefully to her words, too.

Did you know? Everyone is allowed to say what they think is true, and the judge listens to everything before making a decision!

Why is This Important for All of Us?

You might be thinking, 'Why is this story important for me?' Well, it's very important! When people with big jobs are fair and honest, it helps everyone in the country. It means that things like schools, hospitals, and roads are built fairly, and everyone gets a fair chance. If important helpers take 'bad presents,' then things might not be fair for everyone else. This is why it's so important that judges listen very carefully and find out the truth. It helps make sure that Nigeria, and all countries in Africa, are fair and safe places for every child and every grown-up.

Did you know? Good leaders are like good captains of a sports team! They make sure everyone plays fairly and works together for the best outcome!

What Happens Next?

So, what happens now? The judge in the court will keep listening to all the stories. They will listen to what the people who say Mrs. Diezani took 'bad presents' have to say. And they will listen very carefully to what Mrs. Diezani says, because she says she didn't do it. It might take some time, just like it takes time to finish a big puzzle. But in the end, the judge will decide what they think is the truth. And this helps everyone remember that rules are there to keep us all safe and make sure life is fair for every single person in Nigeria. We will keep you updated on what happens next, super friends! Stay fair and stay kind!
summary: In Nigeria, a lady who used to have an important job is in a special room called a court because some people say she took unfair presents, but she says she did not.
whyMatters: This story matters because following rules and being fair helps everyone in a country, making sure schools, hospitals, and roads are good for all children and grown-ups, not just a few.

originalTitle: South Africa secures return of 11 men ‘lured’ into Russia-Ukraine war
title: A Happy Return! Our Friends Are Home!
content:
Hello, everyone! We have some super happy news to share today! Guess what? Some of our brothers, uncles, and friends are back home in South Africa! They were very, very far away, but now they are safe and sound. This is a truly wonderful and happy day for many families across our beautiful country. Everyone is smiling and giving big hugs to their loved ones who have returned.

A Big Happy Welcome Home!

Imagine being away from your family for a very, very long time. Now, imagine finally coming back and seeing everyone you love! That's exactly what happened for 11 special men from South Africa. They travelled a very long way, over many lands and seas, to come back to their homes here. Their families were so, so excited to see them walk through the door. Can you imagine the big smiles, the happy tears, and all the warm hugs? It’s a wonderful feeling to be home, where you are safe, loved, and sound. Everyone is celebrating this special moment of reunion and joy.

Why Were Our Friends Far Away?

These men were in a country called Russia. Russia is very, very far from South Africa, way across the ocean! Now, in Russia, there is a big argument, like a fight, happening with another country called Ukraine. It's a sad and serious situation, far, far away from us. Sometimes, people are asked to join these big fights, even if they don't really know what they are getting into. This is called being 'lured.' It means someone might have convinced them to go, maybe without telling them all the dangers or the truth about the situation. It's like someone inviting you to play a game, but it turns out to be a very, very dangerous game that you didn't want to play. Our government, which is like the big team that looks after our whole country, did not want our people to be in that dangerous place. They want all South Africans to be safe and sound right here at home, away from faraway troubles.

Working Together to Bring Them Home

Bringing people back from far, far away needs help from very important leaders. Our country's President, Mr. Cyril Ramaphosa, worked very, very hard to make this happen. He is like the captain of our country's team, making sure everyone is okay. President Ramaphosa talked to the President of Russia, Mr. Vladimir Putin. These two leaders are like the head teachers of their countries. President Ramaphosa kindly asked President Putin for his help to bring our men back home to South Africa. It’s a bit like when you ask your friend's mum for help if your friend is lost – you ask nicely, and they help you. President Putin said yes! He helped make sure our men could travel back safely. Our President, Mr. Ramaphosa, said a very big and heartfelt 'Thank you' to President Putin for being so helpful and kind. This shows us that leaders from different countries can work together, even if their countries are far apart, to do good and important things. Working together makes the world a better, safer, and happier place for everyone.

A Long Journey Back

Imagine packing a bag for a very, very long trip. These 11 men had to travel for many, many hours, maybe even a whole day or two, to get back to South Africa. They probably travelled in a big aeroplane, flying high above the clouds, like birds. Think of all the countries and oceans they flew over to reach our beautiful land. It must have felt like forever, waiting to get back. But every mile, every minute, brought them closer and closer to their families and homes. When they finally landed here in South Africa, they were one giant step closer to seeing their loved ones. This journey was very important for their safety and their future happiness.

Hugs and Smiles for Families

One of the very best parts of people coming home is the reunion! Families were waiting, maybe at the airport or right at their homes, full of excitement and hope. Can you imagine the biggest hugs you've ever seen? The happy cries? The joyful shouts of 'You're home!'? Mothers, fathers, sisters, brothers, and children finally got to see their loved ones again after a long time. They can now share stories, eat their favourite foods together, and just be a family again. Being with family makes everything better. It's where we feel the most loved, the most protected, and the safest. This happy ending shows how much our leaders care about the people of South Africa. They want families to be whole and happy, always.

Always Choose Peace

This whole story teaches us something very important. It's always, always better to talk and share than to fight. Our country, South Africa, loves peace very much. We believe in talking things out and finding friendly solutions to problems. We don't want our people to be part of big fights or arguments in other countries. Being safe and staying out of harm's way is the most important thing for all of us. So, let's always try our best to be kind, to use our words to solve problems, and to choose peace over fighting, every single day.

Did You Know?

* **Did you know?** South Africa is famous for having three capital cities! Each one has a special job. How cool is that? * **Did you know?** Our President, Mr. Cyril Ramaphosa, is like the leader of our big South African family. He helps make important decisions for all of us, like bringing our friends home! * **Did you know?** Russia is the biggest country in the whole wide world! It's so big that it takes many days to drive all the way across it. * **Did you know?** When countries help each other, it's called 'diplomacy.' It's like being good neighbours on a very, very big scale, helping each other out. * **Did you know?** Home is one of the safest places to be in the world. It's where your family protects you, loves you the most, and helps you feel secure.

Being Safe and Happy

So, this news is all about being safe and happy right here at home in South Africa. It's about our wonderful leaders working together, across big distances, to protect us and our people. It reminds us that even when people go far away, we can work hard to bring them back to where they belong. Let's all be grateful for our homes, for our families, and for the people who work to keep us safe. And remember, choosing peace and kindness, not just in big countries, but in our schools and playgrounds too, makes our whole world a brighter, happier place, from South Africa to everywhere! Hooray for our friends coming home!
summary: Eleven men from South Africa who were in Russia during a faraway conflict have been safely brought back home thanks to the help of President Ramaphosa and President Putin.
whyMatters: This is important because it means our government cares very much about keeping all South Africans safe, even when they are far from home, and it shows that leaders from different countries can work together for peace and family happiness.

originalTitle: Bodo/Glimt knock out Inter Milan, continue fairytale Champions League run
title: Little Team, Big Dream! A Football Fairytale!
content:
Hello, My Wonderful Friends!

Hello, hello, amazing kids of Africa! I am your friendly news reporter, bringing you exciting stories from around the world. I have some super exciting news for you today! It’s all about football, big dreams, and how small teams can do giant things. Let’s hear this amazing story together!

A Big Football Story!

Imagine a small, small ant challenging a huge elephant and winning! That is almost what happened in a big football game far, far away. A team called Bodo/Glimt has done something truly special. They won against a very famous team called Inter Milan. Everyone is talking about this big surprise! It shows that sometimes, the underdog, the small team, can be the biggest hero. This is why we love football so much – it’s full of surprises!

Who are Bodo/Glimt?

Bodo/Glimt is a football team from a country called Norway. Norway is far, far away, in the northern part of the world. This team is not very famous. Most people had never heard of them before this year! They don't have super famous football players. These are not the stars you see on TV advertisements for shoes or drinks. They are just regular players who love football and work very hard. Also, Bodo/Glimt doesn't have a lot of money. We call this a "tiny budget." This means they don't have super fancy new stadiums or super expensive training clothes like the big, rich teams. They make the best of what they have, and they do it with a lot of heart. Did you know? Norway is a beautiful country known for its amazing natural beauty, like huge mountains and sometimes lots of snow! It can get very cold there!

Who are Inter Milan?

Now, let's talk about Inter Milan. Oh, they are a giant of a team! They come from Italy, a sunny country in Europe. Inter Milan is known all over the world. They are one of the biggest and richest football clubs. They have many, many famous players. These players are superstars! They have won many big games and shiny trophies before. They also have lots of money. They can buy the best players from anywhere and have the best training places. Did you know? Italy is famous for delicious pizza and pasta! And it's also a country where football is super, super popular, just like here in Africa! People there love their football teams a lot.

What is the Champions League?

This big game was part of something called the "Champions League." It's not just any football game. The Champions League is like the biggest football party for club teams in all of Europe! Only the very, very best teams get to play in it. It's where all the champions from different countries come together. They play against each other to find out who is the absolute best team in Europe! Winning the Champions League is a huge, huge honour. It means you are one of the world's top teams. Did you know? The Champions League trophy is very big and shiny! It's one of the most famous trophies in all of sports, and every player dreams of lifting it up!

The Amazing Win!

So, Bodo/Glimt, the small team with not much money and not many famous players, played against Inter Milan, the big, famous team with lots of money and superstars. No one expected Bodo/Glimt to win. Everyone thought Inter Milan would win easily, maybe by many goals. But Bodo/Glimt played with amazing courage. They ran faster, they passed better, and they never gave up. They played with all their hearts and all their teamwork! And guess what? They won the game! It was a massive surprise to everyone watching around the world. When a team "knocks out" another team, it means they win against them, and the losing team cannot play in that competition anymore. So, Bodo/Glimt knocked out Inter Milan! They sent the famous team packing! What an incredible achievement for the small team!

Still Playing Strong!

Now, Bodo/Glimt is not just happy with one big win. They are continuing their amazing journey! They have moved onto the "last 16" of the Champions League. This means that out of all the many, many teams that started, only 16 are left in the whole big competition. Bodo/Glimt is one of those 16 teams! They are still in the big competition, still fighting to win the giant trophy. They keep surprising everyone and making people believe in magic. Their journey is far from over, and we can’t wait to see what they do next! Did you know? In football, "teamwork" is super important! When everyone works together and helps each other, even a small team can become super strong and beat bigger opponents!

A True Fairytale!

We call this a "fairytale" run. A fairytale is a story where something amazing and almost magical happens. Like a princess finding her prince, or a poor person becoming rich through a magical event. This is a football fairytale because Bodo/Glimt is showing the world that you don't need lots of money or super famous players to be great. You just need passion, hard work, and to believe in yourselves. It's a story that makes your heart feel warm and excited! Did you know? Many amazing football stars from Africa, like George Weah from Liberia or Jay-Jay Okocha from Nigeria, started playing football on dusty fields with simple balls! They became champions through hard work and belief, just like Bodo/Glimt is showing us!

What This Means for All of Us!

This story is very important for all of us, especially for you, my young friends. It tells us that no dream is too big. Even if you come from a small place, or don't have much money, you can achieve amazing things. It shows us that with hard work, teamwork, and never giving up, you can beat even the biggest challenges. This is true for football, for school, and for anything you want to do in life! Let's all cheer for Bodo/Glimt and their incredible journey!

Keep Dreaming Big!

So, remember the name Bodo/Glimt! And remember their lesson: always dream big, work hard, and believe in yourself and your team. Thank you for listening, my wonderful friends! Until next time, keep shining bright and chasing your dreams!
summary: A small football team from Norway called Bodo/Glimt, with little money and no famous players, has made a big surprise by beating a huge team, Inter Milan, and is still doing amazing things in the world's biggest club football competition, the Champions League.
whyMatters: This amazing story shows us that even small teams can do giant things with hard work and teamwork, proving that big dreams can come true for anyone, no matter how small they start, which is a great lesson for all of us in Africa and around the world.

originalTitle: Germany’s Merz arrives in China for two-day visit with focus on trade
title: A Friendly Visit: Germany and China Talk About Sharing and Trading!
content:
Hello, Amazing Kids of Africa!

Guess what? Exciting things are happening far away, but they can still be good news for us! Imagine two very big countries, like two big friends, getting together to talk. One is Germany, and the other is China. A very important person from Germany recently flew all the way to China to have some important talks. It was a special visit that lasted for two days, like a very busy weekend!

Who is this Important Person, Mr. Merz?

In Germany, there's a leader named Mr. Merz. He's like a very big boss, a very important person who helps Germany make good friends with other countries. His job is to make sure Germany works well with everyone around the world. He wants to help Germany share and trade things nicely with other big countries, like China. Did you know? Germany is a country in Europe. It's famous for making super cool cars and delicious bread! People there work very hard to make many things.

Where Did He Go? All the Way to China!

Mr. Merz travelled a very, very long way to a country called China. China is also a super big country, far away from Germany and also far away from many parts of Africa. It’s a place with many people and many amazing things. Did you know? China is home to giant pandas, which are super cute bears that love to eat bamboo! It also has a very, very long wall called the Great Wall of China, which you can even see from space!

What Were They Talking About? It's Called 'Trade'!

So, why did Mr. Merz go all that way? He went to talk about something called 'trade'. What is trade? Imagine you have a yummy snack, and your friend has a cool toy. You might swap your snack for a chance to play with their toy! That's a bit like trade, but for countries. Countries make things, like clothes, phones, or even special food. Then, they buy things from other countries and sell things to other countries. This is called trade. Germany sells its cars, and China sells its electronics, and they also buy things from each other. Did you know? People have been trading for thousands of years! Long, long ago, people would trade animal skins, salt, or shiny stones for food or tools. It helped everyone get what they needed.

Making Trade Fairer and Deeper

Mr. Merz had two big goals during his visit. First, he wanted to make the trade relationship 'deeper'. This means he wanted Germany and China to buy and sell even more things from each other, like becoming even better friends who share lots of things. The more they trade, the more things people can get, and the more jobs there might be! Second, he wanted to make the trade 'fairer'. Imagine you and your friend are swapping snacks, and you make sure both of you get an equal amount of yummy treats. That’s being fair! Mr. Merz wanted to make sure that when Germany and China trade, both countries feel happy and get a good deal. Nobody should feel like they are getting less.

Signing Agreements: Making Promises

During his visit, Mr. Merz and the leaders in China did something very important. They 'signed several agreements'. What are agreements? They are like special promises or rules that countries make to each other. When you sign an agreement, it means you promise to do something. These agreements were about how Germany and China will trade in the future. They talked about buying more things, selling more things, and making sure everyone follows the rules. It's like when you make a promise to your friend to play together nicely tomorrow. It helps everyone know what to expect and work better together.

How Does This Help Us in Africa?

You might be thinking, "Germany and China are so far away from Africa, why is this important for me?" Well, when big countries like Germany and China work together and trade fairly, it's good for the whole world! When countries trade more, it means more things are made, and more people have jobs. This can help the world economy grow. Many countries in Africa also trade with Germany and China. For example, some African countries sell delicious fruits or special minerals to these big countries. When Germany and China are doing well, it can mean more opportunities for our countries in Africa too! Did you know? Africa is a continent full of many beautiful countries, with amazing animals like lions and elephants, and lots of important natural treasures that other countries want to buy. We also make and sell wonderful things!

A World of Friends!

So, Mr. Merz's visit was like a very important playdate between two big countries. They talked about sharing, being fair, and making good promises. When countries work together like this, it makes our world a more friendly and helpful place for everyone, including all of us here in Africa! Keep learning and asking questions, amazing kids!
summary: An important leader from Germany, Mr. Merz, visited China for two days to talk about making trade between their countries stronger and fairer, and they signed special promises to work together.
whyMatters: When big countries like Germany and China work together and trade fairly, it helps everyone in the world get new things, creates more jobs, and makes the world a friendlier place for countries everywhere, including us in Africa.

originalTitle: Analysis: Trump issues patriotic rallying cry with eye on crucial elections
title: Super Speech from America's Big Boss!
content:
Hello, amazing friends! It's your kid-friendly reporter from Africa, here to tell you about something exciting happening far, far away! Today, we're going on a little adventure all the way to a big country called America. Have you ever heard of it? It's across the big blue ocean! We're going to learn about a very important person there and a very special kind of talk he gave. It's like a story, but it's real news!

Meet the President!

In America, just like in many countries, they have a special leader called a President. Imagine your school has a head teacher, or your class has a class captain. A President is like the biggest leader for the whole country! They help make important decisions and try to make life good for everyone. They work very hard every day. The President we are talking about today is a very famous person. He stands in front of many people and talks about what he thinks is best for his country. It's a big job, like being the captain of a very, very big team! **Did you know?** The President of America lives in a special house called the White House! It has many rooms and is where lots of important meetings happen.

America: A Country Far Away

So, where is America? If you look at a big map of the world, you'll see our amazing continent of Africa. Then, if you look way across the big blue ocean, you'll find America! It's a huge country with many, many cities and many people. Just like we have different languages and cultures in Africa, America also has many different people from all over the world living there. It might seem far, but with news and stories, we can learn about people and places all over the globe! Isn't that wonderful? We can be friends with people even if they live far away. **Did you know?** America has 50 different states, which are like big regions, and each one has its own special things and leaders!

A Very, Very Long Talk!

Our news story tells us that the President of America gave a very long speech. What's a speech? It's when someone stands up and talks to many people about important things. Maybe your teacher gives a speech to the whole school during assembly, or your pastor gives a sermon. Well, the President's speech was super long, like a 'marathon'! Have you ever seen a marathon runner? They run for a very long time without stopping. This speech was like that, but with words! He talked for a very, very long time, sharing his ideas and what he thinks is important for America. Imagine talking for an hour or even two hours! That's a lot of talking! **Did you know?** Some speeches are so famous that children learn about them in school many years later! They can help change how people think and feel.

Talking to His Friends and Supporters

Now, why would a President talk for so long? Our news says he 'appealed to his base'. This is a grown-up way of saying he was talking to all the people who already like him very much and support him. Think of it like this: if you have a favorite football team, you cheer for them, right? And the team captain might say things that make you, their fan, feel very happy and proud! So, the President was telling his supporters all the good things he thinks he has done and all the good plans he has for the future. He wanted them to feel strong and proud, and to keep believing in him. It's like a team leader telling their team how great they are and how they will win the next game! **Did you know?** When leaders talk to their supporters, it helps everyone feel like they are part of the same team, working towards the same goals for their country.

Strong Words for the Other Team

originalTitle: Ukraine remembers its dead as war enters a fifth year
title: Remembering Friends: A Story from Ukraine
content:
Hello, My Amazing Friends!

Hi everyone! It's your kid-friendly news reporter from Africa, here with an important story! Today, we are going to learn about a country far, far away from us, called Ukraine. It's a place with many wonderful people, just like us, who have been going through a very sad time.

What's Happening in Ukraine?

Imagine you are playing happily with all your friends. Then, suddenly, something big and scary changes everything. This is a little bit like what happened in Ukraine a few years ago. There is a 'war' there. A war is when countries have a very, very big fight. It makes many people sad and scared, and it can be very dangerous. It's not like a small argument between friends; it's much, much bigger and very serious for everyone. This big fight in Ukraine has been going on for a very long time. Can you believe it? It has been four whole years already! That's a lot of birthdays, a lot of school years, and a lot of playtime. And now, it is starting its fifth year. This means the big fight has been happening for more than four complete years. That is a very, very long time for people to be sad and worried.

Remembering People We Miss

When big, sad things happen like a war, some people get hurt. Sadly, some people even lose their lives. This means they are not with us anymore, and they go to heaven. This makes their families and friends very, very sad. They miss them so much, just like you might miss a pet or a family member who is far away. In Ukraine, people recently had special quiet times to remember all the people who are not there anymore because of the war. It's a way for them to say, 'We remember you. We love you. We will never forget you.' It's like how we might remember our grandmas or grandpas who have passed away. They had quiet moments of thinking. They lit candles, which give off a soft, warm light. They said special prayers. All these things help people feel a little bit better, even when they are feeling very sad inside. It shows that they care deeply about each other and about those they have lost. **Did you know?** Many people all over the world, even here in Africa, pray for peace in Ukraine! Peace means no more fighting, only friends, happiness, and safety for everyone.

Where is Ukraine?

Ukraine is a country that is very far away from Africa. If you were to fly in a super-fast airplane for many, many hours, across oceans and land, you might get there! It's in a part of the world called Europe. It's a big country, just like some of the big and beautiful countries we have here in Africa. It has lovely farms, busy cities, and many schools where children learn. **Did you know?** Ukraine is very famous for growing lots and lots of food, especially big, beautiful sunflowers! Sunflowers are bright yellow flowers that always turn their heads to follow the sun. They are so pretty and cheerful!

Why Are We Talking About This?

You might ask, 'Why do we need to know about something happening so far away?' That's a really good question! Even though Ukraine is far, we are all people living together on the same planet. When people anywhere in the world are sad or hurt, it's good for us to know. It helps us learn about being kind and how important it is for everyone to live together peacefully. It also teaches us to appreciate the peace we have in many parts of Africa. We learn to be thankful for our safe homes and our schools where we can learn and play with our friends without worrying about big fights or dangers.

How War Affects Children

Imagine not being able to go to school because it's not safe outside. Or having to leave your home, your toys, and your friends to go live somewhere new and unfamiliar. This is what some children in Ukraine have had to do. They are very brave children! Some schools in Ukraine have to teach children in special safe places, like underground bunkers, so they are protected from danger. They still try very hard to learn their ABCs and 123s, just like you do! But they miss their normal lives. They miss playing outside freely in the sunshine. **Did you know?** When children and their families have to leave their homes because of war or danger, they are sometimes called 'refugees.' Many kind people in different countries help these children and their families find new, safe places to live and feel safe again.

What is 'Five Years' Like?

Four years is a very, very long time for a war to continue. Imagine going to school from when you were very little in Class 1, all the way until you are big enough for Class 4 or even Class 5! That's how long some children in Ukraine have lived with this big fight happening around them. And now it's starting its fifth year, meaning it has been going on for even longer than that. It means people have been sad, worried, and scared for a very, very long time. It's like a really, really long race that no one wants to run anymore. Everyone, especially the children, just wants it to stop.

Hopes for Peace

Even though this is a sad story, there is always hope! Hope means wishing for good things to happen and believing that they can. People in Ukraine hope very much for peace. They hope that the big fight will stop soon. They hope that everyone can go back to their homes, go to school safely, and play with their friends without any worries or danger. People all around the world, including many kind people in Africa, are helping Ukraine. They send food so people don't go hungry, medicine to help the sick, and warm clothes. They even send toys and books for the children, to help them feel a little bit happier. They do all this because they believe in helping each other when times are tough. **Did you know?** Many countries work together to try and help solve big problems like wars. They talk and try to find good ways to make peace happen, so everyone can live safely and happily.

Let's Think About Kindness

This story from Ukraine reminds us to be kind to each other every single day. Let's remember to share our toys, use kind words, and help our friends when they need us. When we are kind, we make our own corner of the world a better, more peaceful place for everyone. Let's all hope for peace for our friends in Ukraine and for everyone everywhere around the world. Because when there is peace, everyone can smile, play, and learn happily without any fear. Thank you for listening, my wonderful friends! Stay kind and keep smiling!
summary: People in Ukraine are remembering friends and family who were lost because of a big fight, hoping for peace as this sad time has lasted for four years and is now starting its fifth year.
whyMatters: It's important to know about Ukraine because it teaches us about kindness, how special peace is, and to help people far away, showing we all share one world and should care for each other.
